I recently upgraded to Mac OS X 10.4 and may be having a similar problem. I=
 was able to 
successfully install everything starting from CVS and using g=
cc4 but then when testing 
Cantera in Matlab 7.1, I get:

??? Invalid MEX-f=
ile '/Applications/Cantera/matlab/toolbox/cantera/cantera/
ctmethods.mexmac=
': dlopen(/Applications/Cantera/matlab/toolbox/cantera/cantera/
ctmethods.m=
exmac, 1): Symbol not found: __ZN3tpx9TPX_Error14ErrorProcedureE
  Referenc=
ed from: /Applications/Cantera/matlab/toolbox/cantera/cantera/
ctmethods.me=
xmac
  Expected in: flat namespace

I then tried rebuilding Cantera with gc=
c3.3 (which is how Matlab is built on the Mac) with 
no luck.

Has anybody =
been able to make this work on either Mac 10.4 or Linux?

Thanks -

Josh


=
--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
> Chr=
istian,
> 
> You need to compile Cantera with the same version of gcc that =
MATLAB 
> itself was compiled with.  On the MathWorks web site they have 
>=
 information about the compiler versions for various operating systems.
> 
=
> The problem may be related to changes in libstdc++ in gcc 4.x compared 
>=
 to gcc 3.x. As I understand it, libstdc++ in gcc 4 is a shared library, 
>=
 while in gcc 3 it was a static library. There are probably other 
> incomp=
atibilities between the two versions.
> 
> Some linux systems maintain more=
 than one version of the gcc compilers. 
>   You may be able to specify whi=
ch one to use in the Cantera 'configure' 
> script, to match the one requir=
ed by MATLAB.
> 
> I'm sorry I can't be of more help, but currently I do no=
t have access 
> to a linux machine that has MATLAB installed, so I can't d=
iagnose the 
> problem myself.  Has anyone else encountered and solved this=
 problem?
> 
> 
> Dave
> 
> 
> On Nov 17, 2005, at 11:51 AM, chrtom1979 wro=
te:
> 
> > Dear Mr Goodwin,
> > I have successfully installed Cantera 1.6 u=
nder Suse Linux 10.0, but I
> > still have problems using matlab interface,=
 related to the version of
> > GCC installed. While trying to call gri30 li=
brary, it appears the
> > following error message:
> >
> > ??? Invalid MEX-=
file
> > '/usr/local/matlab/toolbox/cantera/cantera/ctmethods.mexglx':
> > =
/usr/local/matlab/bin/glnx86/../../sys/os/glnx86/libgcc_s.so.1:
> > version=
 `GCC_3.3' not found (required by /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6).
> >
> > I searc=
hed the archieves, and I found that others have encountered
> > this proble=
m, but nobody have solved the question.
> >
> > Can you help me?
> >
> > Th=
ank you in advance
> >
> > Christian
